location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

titleInfo.title: PZ 2688/41 'Propaganda. Use of commercial channels for distribution of propaganda in Afghanistan and the Middle East.'

physicalDescription.extent: The correspondence is arranged in reverse chronological order.

Foliation: the foliation sequence commences at the front cover with 1 and terminates at the inside back cover with 9; these numbers are written in pencil, are circled, and are located in the top right corner of the recto side of each folio.

mods.abstract: The file contains correspondence between the Secretary of State for India, the Government of India, External Affairs Department, HM Minister at Kabul, the India Office and the Ministry of Information, regarding the possible use of commercial companies in India to distribute propaganda materials in Persian and Arabic to Afghanistan and the Middle East.A list of correspondence references contained in the file by year appears on the front cover.

name.namePart: Indian Political Service, External Affairs Department
Secretary of State for India, United Kingdom
